liscio-etal-2023-text.title: What does a Text Classifier Learn about Morality? An Explainable Method for Cross-Domain Comparison of Moral Rhetoric
liscio-etal-2023-text.author:
Liscio, Enrico  and
Araque, Oscar  and
Gatti, Lorenzo  and
Constantinescu, Ionut  and
Jonker, Catholijn  and
Kalimeri, Kyriaki  and
Murukannaiah, Pradeep Kumar
liscio-etal-2023-text.paperMotivationText: There are no systematic methods for analyzing whether a text classifier learns the domain-specific expression of moral language or not.
liscio-etal-2023-text.paperContributionText: They propose Tomea, a method to compare a supervised classifier's representation of moral rhetoric across domains.
liscio-etal-2023-text.paperResultsText: They find that similarities computed by Tomea positively correlate with human annotations and with out-of-domain performance of morality prediction models.
